<figure data-orig-width="480" data-orig-height="92" class="tmblr-full"><img data-orig-width="480" data-orig-height="92" src="http://36.media.tumblr.com/0ff9377afa68dc3ad3fe6844aaf1bd38/tumblr_inline_nw6gvhkN3Z1rr2wit_540.jpg"/></figure><p>Hello everyone!</p><p>With all the big announcements and plan changes out of the way Ã¢â‚¬â€œ if you missed the 1.0.5 announcement you should read last weekÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s devblog Ã¢â‚¬â€œ we have been focusing fully on getting the job done. For 1.0.5 that means the QA team is hard at work testing the various aspects of the update individually before the experimental test team gets their hands on the full update for playtesting. For the 1.1 update that means Felipe (HarvesteR), Mike (Mu) and Jim (Romfarer) continue the user interface work.</p><p>Mike has been juggling the user interface work with finishing the 1.0.5 update for the Part Tools, making sure Chris (Porkjet) can use them to finish the new parts he made for this patch. WeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re looking forward to see what people will do with the PartToolsÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ new shader loaders too.</p><p>ItÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s travel time too, Dan (danRosas) is planning to visit IndieCade in Los Angeles next week because <a href="http://www.indiecade.com/2015/nominees"><b>weÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve been nominated</b></a> for an award there. Apart from Ã¢â‚¬ËœpreparingÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ for the trip by playing all the games that will be on display there, heÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s also been working on the ingame models for the Kerbals, which is a longer-term project. </p><p>In Norway, JimÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s work has revolved around optimizing the tweening operations we talked about last week. The original implementation was rather cumbersome and required a lot of bookkeeping for all the elements in the interface, but a new algorithm has greatly simplified and optimized the process.</p><p>As some of you may have noticed we had planned on updating the servers that run our website, Wiki, Bugtracker and Forums last week, but due to a technical issue weÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve had to postpone it. WeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re still very much on top of this issue though and we hope we can isolate the problem quickly and reschedule the update. Once thatÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s done weÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll be able to solve some issues that have been plaguing the Wiki and Bugtracker in particular for far too long now.</p><p>We were happy to see your positive response to the 1.0.5 announcement. After all, the decision to push the completed content from 1.1 forward in a separate patch was done because we felt you guys shouldnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t have to wait for content we could release in the short term when a completely different and independent part of the update was taking longer than we initially thought. </p><p>Speaking of the 1.0.5 patch, Ted spent yesterday Ã¢â‚¬Å“with his head in Jenkins [the build server]Ã¢â‚¬Â because we were having build issues that prevented OSX and Linux builds from completing. The reasons for these failures seemed random at first, and every time we fixed one issue another one popped up. Almost Ã¢â‚¬Â¦ amounts of coffee thankfully cleared our brains enough to figure out the problem though so now the members of the QA team who use Linux or Mac OSX are swimming in many new builds.</p><p>Many new builds because aside from BobÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s (RoverDude) thermal fixes, NathanaelÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s (NathanKell) thermal fixes and ChrisÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ (Porkjet) parts we are now also testing BrianÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s (Arsonide) contextual contracts and miscellaneous bug fixes. ThatÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s a lot of different branches that are on our QA channels and which branch is tested can change frequently on a per build basis. Thankfully the QA test team is managing this phenomenally and theyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re powering through the testing progress like never before. WeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re still at the beginning of the testing process, but weÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re very happy about the progress.</p><p>On the community end we remember promising you a few pictures of the renovated office once the work was complete, and weÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll add these in below. WeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢d also like to extend our thanks to Bob Fitch and Upsilonaerospace for finishing the Oscar-B awards, and weÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve enjoyed watching the winning videos. </p><p>The Media Group applications have been processed and weÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re contacting all the applicants, successful or not. Hopefully we can give some meaningful feedback to the people who didnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t make the cut, we were very strict in our selections. Andrea (Badie) and Kasper (KasperVld) have reviewed all the channels and have seen some great content. Thank you to everyone who applied.</p>

<blockquote class="imgur-embed-pub" lang="en" data-id="a/V5F5N"><a href="//imgur.com/a/V5F5N">Squad office renovated</a></blockquote><script async src="//s.imgur.com/min/embed.js" charset="utf-8"></script>

First (...tourist mode)!

Nice wall paint, you can watch it head upside down like in space!

Edited October 13, 2015 by Skalou

So... The 1.0.5 has passed under the hands of QA?

Also, congratulation of everyone who got selected!
Nice office. Do you have pics of the old one for comparison?

I can feel the hype building within me.

Ingame kerbal models being worked on sounds great! I can't wait to see what's going to be done. :D
nice, now I want a squad logo on my wall too!

Nice office. Do you have pics of the old one for comparison?

I don't have any pre-renovation pictures. It's the same office, but it looks quite different now!

Good luck for IndieCade!

Nice looking offices - functional! Could do with some massive explosions on walls though... or the top end of a command pod sticking out of the ceiling...

Peace.

Yay! Good news! All good news!

I tried part modding a while ago, but for some reason unity crashed when loading PartTools . Maybe the problem will be fixed with the new PartTools.

Wait, does the new part code stuff mean the mk3 cargo ramp can be added?

Nice meaty devnote. I wonder what the problem was with (Leroy) Jenkins. In the end, did you give him some chicken?

So if 1.0.5 is not yet in Experimentals but you're hoping to get it there "soon," I'd guess we have maybe 2 weeks before 1.0.5 drops. Just sayin'.
Who's going to start the hypetrain?

What does the Kerbal model update entail, is it graphical (mesh and/or texture) and/or a rigging update for animation purposes?

Is this intended to bring the 'trailer' Kerbals and in-game Kerbals (graphically) closer together?

What does the Kerbal model update entail, is it graphical (mesh and/or texture) and/or a rigging update for animation purposes?

Is this intended to bring the 'trailer' Kerbals and in-game Kerbals (graphically) closer together?

It did mention "In game update" so I presume it means the in game kerbals are getting updated somehow, and during squadcast there was mention of the surface sample animation being near completion, so hopefully it's more than just a jawbone rigging update.

It did mention "In game update" so I presume it means the in game kerbals are getting updated somehow, and during squadcast there was mention of the surface sample animation being near completion, so hopefully it's more than just a jawbone rigging update.

I think the (in-game) Kerbals are currently 'old style' animated (I can't remember how this was specifically described), so I assume part of the update will revolve around updating them to work via Mechanim (the Unity animation system)?

From what I read about Unity networking, this would also allow the animation states (mechanim says do this) to be disseminated more effectively (which would be pertinent for multiplayer)
MKIII Space Plane ramp?
Doesn't look like the renovation's done yet, that's raw floor sheeting under the desks and by the doors.
Looks like I have some recompiling coming up. Joy.

Doesn't look like the renovation's done yet, that's raw floor sheeting under the desks and by the doors.

Looks like a drop ceiling with no tiles too. Probably just not done yet.

...and here I just started making Blender models for a mod project. Looks like I may hold off on the release until 1.0.5. Gives me time to polish up what I've got so far.

Doesn't look like the renovation's done yet, that's raw floor sheeting under the desks and by the doors.

Someone get these guys a nice, plush carpet!

Who's going to start the hypetrain?

No.

Anyway, I took 5 hours in photoshop* to enhance this image, can any one discern any 1.0.5. secrets from this photo from inside squad HQ? I had an undercover agent recover it, they are in deep so don't blow their cover.

*Not really 5 hours in photoshop, it was more like 1 minute in MS Paint, but that is not the point here, don't read too much into it, stop reading this, really, its pointless

That is a very nice logo on the wall, but I'm noticing a dearth of KSP-related merch on the desks, or any toys of any kind, really. I have a Jeb from Shapeways on my desk, and he'll make any disasterous day seem like fun.

Nice meaty devnote. I wonder what the problem was with (Leroy) Jenkins. In the end, did you give him some chicken?

So if 1.0.5 is not yet in Experimentals but you're hoping to get it there "soon," I'd guess we have maybe 2 weeks before 1.0.5 drops. Just sayin'.

Every freakin' chicken in the room.

(ok, sorry, wrong genre)

WeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢d also like to extend our thanks to Bob Fitch and Upsilonaerospace for finishing the Oscar-B awards, and weÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve enjoyed watching the winning videos.

I'm so glad to see this here! There area lot of talented fans in this community.

I love Tuesdays. My predictions:

The Mk3 Cargo Ramp will not be in 1.0.5

The office is done but the floor and ceiling are just "modern"

1.0.5 will be released in 2 weeks-ish

The kerbal model update IS an update to a new animation style.

1.1 is going to be amazing. Not to knock 1.0.5 because its awesome we're getting that but the Unity 5 update is super exciting. I'm so glad Squad decided to split the two and now don't have to feel the pressure of needing to release an update and having to make tough decisions rushing something out. Take your time guys and give us something truly amazing when it's good and ready.
